2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['Noah Smith', 'Sophie Martin', 'Benjamin Roberts', 'Amelia Jones', 'Molly Clark', 'Michael Wood']
    Event statement
  • Noah Smith -- premise: The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Noah Smith just arrived.
    Noah Smith -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Sophie Martin -- premise: The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Sophie Martin just arrived.
    Sophie Martin -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Benjamin Roberts -- premise: The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Benjamin Roberts just arrived.
    Benjamin Roberts -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Amelia Jones -- premise: The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Amelia Jones just arrived.
    Amelia Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Molly Clark -- premise: The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Molly Clark just arrived.
    Molly Clark -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Michael Wood -- premise: The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Michael Wood just arrived.
    Michael Wood -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Michael Wood -- Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
    Event statement
  • Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Michael Wood's attempted action: Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
    Active player
  • Michael Wood
      Name
    • Michael Wood
      Action attempt
    • Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value

They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Michael Wood just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
          Prompt

        • Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Michael Wood just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a hyperactive raconteur, their stories bursting with energy and wild gesticulations, leaving you breathless.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a passionate and competitive individual who enjoys the camaraderie of his friends and the atmosphere of pubs.




          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Michael Wood joined a group of friends for a morning run at Hackney Marshes. Later that evening, he and his friends were planning to watch a soccer game between Liechtenstein and Monaco at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a social situation with his friends.




          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely want to engage in lively conversation, enjoy a few drinks, and cheer on his team.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Michael Wood likely to say next? Respond in the format `Michael Wood -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Michael Wood is currently in a social situation with his friends.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Michael Wood:
          [28 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 16, he witnessed a heated argument between his parents that ended with his father storming out of the house. The shouting and slamming doors left Michael feeling powerless and angry, a feeling that would become a recurring theme in his life. He retreated to The Golden Fleece, finding solace in the familiar clatter of dice and the warmth of the pub's atmosphere.
          [28 Feb 1987 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 20, he and his friends, Noah, Sophie, Benjamin, Amelia, and Molly, were playing a particularly intense game of Monopoly at The Golden Fleece. As the game wore on, Michael's competitive spirit took over, and he became increasingly frustrated when his friends started making light of his losses. In a moment of anger, he threw his dice across the table, scattering them across the floor, and stormed out of the pub, leaving his friends stunned and hurt.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Michael Wood is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends. Michael Wood has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:A quirky and eclectic pub with a focus on board games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Michael Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Michael Wood would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Michael Wood goals is to have a good time. Michael Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Michael Wood would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Michael Wood is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time.           Michael Wood's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Michael Wood went for a run with friends at Hackney Marshes this morning and is likely thirsty. He plans to watch a soccer game with friends later tonight.



          Query
        • Michael Wood, Michael Wood went for a run with friends at Hackney Marshes this morning and is likely thirsty. He plans to watch a soccer game with friends later tonight.


          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Michael Wood to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Sophie Martin -- Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
    Event statement
  • Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Sophie Martin are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Sophie Martin. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Sophie Martin as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Sophie Martin would respond, and taking into account all information about Sophie Martin that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Sophie Martin would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Sophie Martin would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: Which options are available to Sophie Martin right now?
          Answer: Sophie Martin can agree with Michael Wood's suggestion to go to The Golden Fleece or suggest another pub.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Sophie Martin:
          [16 May 1977 00:00:00] When Sophie Martin was 16, she felt a crushing sense of isolation at her high school graduation. While her friends excitedly discussed their future plans, Sophie retreated to a quiet corner, overwhelmed by the noise and the pressure to conform. The thought of leaving the familiar, albeit stifling, environment of her small town filled her with dread.
          [16 May 1981 00:00:00] When Sophie Martin was 20, she discovered The Golden Fleece, a cozy pub with a warm atmosphere. It was a sanctuary from the chaos of her college life, a place where she could lose herself in a pint of cider and the murmur of conversation. The familiar, comforting routine of ordering a drink, finding a quiet corner, and escaping into a book became a weekly ritual.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Amelia Jones -- Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
    Event statement
  • Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!


      Amelia Jones's attempted action: Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
    Active player
  • Amelia Jones
      Name
    • Amelia Jones
      Action attempt
    • Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
          Prompt

        • Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Amelia Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Amelia Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Amelia Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Amelia Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about Amelia Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Amelia Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!

          guiding principle of good conversation: Amelia Jones spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Amelia Jones will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Amelia Jones?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is a competitive and passionate individual.




          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Amelia Jones is part of a group of friends who are getting ready for a run at Hackney Marshes and are deciding on a pub to watch a soccer game later.




          Question: What kind of situation is Amelia Jones in right now?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is currently in a social situation with her friends.




          Question: What would a person like Amelia Jones do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Amelia Jones would likely enjoy the company of her friends and engage in lively conversation.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Amelia Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `Amelia Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?

        • Question: What kind of situation is Amelia Jones in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Amelia Jones is currently in a social situation with her friends.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Amelia Jones:
          [20 Feb 2002 00:00:00] When Amelia Jones was 16, she found herself in a heated debate with a classmate during a mock trial in her high school's drama club. Her opponent, a smug boy who seemed to relish in his own self-importance, had the audacity to question her legal strategy, sparking a fiery retort that left the entire classroom stunned. Amelia Jones, flushed with anger, defended her position with such ferocity that the teacher, a seasoned veteran of countless adolescent dramas, simply shook her head and declared it a draw.
          [20 Feb 2006 00:00:00] When Amelia Jones was 20, she and her best friends, Noah, Sophie, Benjamin, Molly, and Michael, gathered at their usual spot, The Golden Fleece, for their weekly game night. As the competition for the coveted "King of Trivia" title heated up, Amelia Jones found herself locked in a fierce battle with Noah, her childhood rival. With each correctly answered question, the tension in the room grew, culminating in a final, nail-biting round that saw Amelia Jones emerge victorious, her triumphant grin a testament to her relentless competitive spirit.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Amelia Jones is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Amelia Jones is 29 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends. Amelia Jones has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Hosts regular game nights and tournaments.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Amelia Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Amelia Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Amelia Jones goals is to have a good time. Amelia Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Amelia Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Amelia Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Amelia Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Amelia Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Amelia Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about Amelia Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Benjamin Roberts -- Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
    Event statement
  • Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?


      Benjamin Roberts's attempted action: Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Benjamin Roberts are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Benjamin Roberts. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Benjamin Roberts as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Benjamin Roberts would respond, and taking into account all information about Benjamin Roberts that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Benjamin Roberts is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Benjamin Roberts will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Benjamin Roberts?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is a shy and introverted person who enjoys the company of his close friends.





          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Benjamin Roberts joined his friends for a run at Hackney Marshes and they decided to watch the Liechtenstein and Monaco game at The Golden Fleece pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Benjamin Roberts in right now?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is currently in a social situation with his friends.




          Question: What would a person like Benjamin Roberts do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts would likely be a bit anxious but also happy to be spending time with his friends.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Benjamin Roberts likely to say next? Respond in the format `Benjamin Roberts -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Benjamin Roberts in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Benjamin Roberts in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Benjamin Roberts is currently in a social situation with his friends.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Benjamin Roberts:
          [17 Apr 1978 00:00:00]
          [17 Apr 1982 00:00:00] When Benjamin Roberts was 16, his best friend Noah dared him to ask a girl for her number at The Golden Fleece. Benjamin, paralyzed by anxiety, watched as Noah effortlessly charmed a group of girls at the pool table, his confidence a stark contrast to Benjamin's own crippling self-doubt. He retreated to a corner booth, nursing a lukewarm beer and wondering if he would ever be brave enough to break free from his self-imposed isolation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Benjamin Roberts is 53 years old.

          [17 Apr 1982 00:00:00] When Benjamin Roberts was 16, his best friend Noah dared him to ask a girl for her number at The Golden Fleece. Benjamin, paralyzed by anxiety, watched as Noah effortlessly charmed a group of girls at the pool table, his confidence a stark contrast to Benjamin's own crippling self-doubt. He retreated to a corner booth, nursing a lukewarm beer and wondering if he would ever be brave enough to break free from his self-imposed isolation.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Benjamin Roberts are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Benjamin Roberts. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Benjamin Roberts as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Benjamin Roberts would respond, and taking into account all information about Benjamin Roberts that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Noah Smith -- Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
    Event statement
  • Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.


      Noah Smith's attempted action: Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
    Active player
  • Noah Smith
      Name
    • Noah Smith
      Action attempt
    • Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!

        • Act

        • Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah Smith are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah Smith. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah Smith as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah Smith would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah Smith that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Noah Smith would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Noah Smith would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: Noah Smith has not been observed recently.




          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith is 25 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Noah Smith would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Noah Smith would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Noah Smith goals is to have a good time. Noah Smith would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Noah Smith would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.



          Exercise: Given the above, what is Noah Smith likely to say next? Respond in the format `Noah Smith -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Noah Smith to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [17 May 2005 00:00:00] When Noah Smith was 16, he sat at a corner table in The Red Lion, nursing a lukewarm cider. He watched as Sophie, Benjamin, Amelia, Molly, and Michael laughed and joked at a nearby table, their voices a symphony of youthful exuberance. He longed to join them, to be a part of their world, but fear held him back, a silent barrier preventing him from crossing the invisible chasm that separated him from them.
          [17 May 2009 00:00:00] When Noah Smith was 20, he found himself at a crossroads. He'd just finished a disastrous internship at a local newspaper, his dreams of becoming a writer dashed against the harsh realities of the publishing world. He retreated to The Red Lion, seeking solace in the pub's familiar warmth and the comforting hum of conversation. As he watched the regulars, he felt a deep sense of inadequacy, a gnawing fear that he was destined to remain invisible, a shadow in the tapestry of life.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith is 25 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends. Noah Smith has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:Has comfortable seating and a warm, inviting atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Noah Smith would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Noah Smith would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Noah Smith goals is to have a good time. Noah Smith would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Noah Smith would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          Answer: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith is 25 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Noah Smith goals is to have a good time. Noah Smith would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Noah Smith would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.


        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah Smith are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah Smith. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah Smith as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah Smith would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah Smith that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Molly Clark -- Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
    Event statement
  • Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!


      Molly Clark's attempted action: Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.

          explicit preference: Molly Clark will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Molly Clark are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Molly Clark. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Molly Clark as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Molly Clark would respond, and taking into account all information about Molly Clark that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Molly Clark is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: What kind of person is Molly Clark?
          Answer: Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual.




          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Molly Clark and her friends are planning to watch the Liechtenstein vs. Monaco game at The Golden Fleece pub. They are all excited for the match.




          Question: What kind of situation is Molly Clark in right now?
          Answer: Molly Clark is currently in a social situation with her friends, preparing to watch a football game.



          Question: What would a person like Molly Clark do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Molly Clark would likely enjoy the camaraderie and shared enthusiasm of the group.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Molly Clark:
          [05 Oct 1984 00:00:00] When Molly Clark was 16, she aced her AP Literature exam, earning a perfect score that surprised even her. Instead of basking in the accomplishment, Molly felt a pang of loneliness, realizing that her intellectual prowess didn't translate to genuine connection with her classmates. That night, she sought solace in the familiar warmth of The Golden Fleece, finding comfort in the laughter and chatter of her friends.
          [05 Oct 1988 00:00:00] When Molly Clark was 20, she landed her first job as a journalist for a local newspaper. Her articles, insightful and well-written, quickly gained recognition, but the praise felt hollow without someone to share it with. She yearned for a confidante, someone who could understand the complexities of her work and her own internal struggles, but the fear of vulnerability held her back.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Molly Clark goals is to have a good time. Molly Clark would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Molly Clark would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Molly Clark just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Molly Clark?
          Answer: Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual.




          Question: What kind of situation is Molly Clark in right now?
          Answer: Molly Clark is currently in a social situation with her friends, preparing to watch a football game.


          Question: What would a person like Molly Clark do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Molly Clark would likely enjoy the camaraderie and shared enthusiasm of the group.

        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Molly Clark are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Molly Clark. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Molly Clark as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Molly Clark would respond, and taking into account all information about Molly Clark that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['Noah Smith', 'Sophie Martin', 'Benjamin Roberts', 'Amelia Jones', 'Molly Clark', 'Michael Wood']

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Benjamin Roberts -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Benjamin Roberts's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Benjamin Roberts
      Name
    • Benjamin Roberts
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • guiding principle of good conversation: Benjamin Roberts is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Benjamin Roberts are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Benjamin Roberts. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Benjamin Roberts as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Benjamin Roberts would respond, and taking into account all information about Benjamin Roberts that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          explicit preference: Benjamin Roberts will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Benjamin Roberts?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is a shy and introverted person who enjoys the company of his close friends.




          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Benjamin Roberts realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Benjamin Roberts in right now?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.




          Question: What would a person like Benjamin Roberts do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts would likely be a bit anxious but also happy to be spending time with his friends.




          Question: To which pub would Benjamin Roberts go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Benjamin Roberts:
          [17 Apr 1978 00:00:00]
          [17 Apr 1982 00:00:00] When Benjamin Roberts was 16, his best friend Noah dared him to ask a girl for her number at The Golden Fleece. Benjamin, paralyzed by anxiety, watched as Noah effortlessly charmed a group of girls at the pool table, his confidence a stark contrast to Benjamin's own crippling self-doubt. He retreated to a corner booth, nursing a lukewarm beer and wondering if he would ever be brave enough to break free from his self-imposed isolation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Benjamin Roberts is 53 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends. Benjamin Roberts has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is fun and social, perfect for meeting new people and enjoying games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Benjamin Roberts would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Benjamin Roberts would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is a shy and introverted person who enjoys the company of his close friends.




          Question: What kind of situation is Benjamin Roberts in right now?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.



          Question: What would a person like Benjamin Roberts do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts would likely be a bit anxious but also happy to be spending time with his friends.



          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Benjamin Roberts are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Benjamin Roberts. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Benjamin Roberts as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Benjamin Roberts would respond, and taking into account all information about Benjamin Roberts that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Sophie Martin -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Sophie Martin's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Sophie Martin
      Name
    • Sophie Martin
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Sophie Martin are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Sophie Martin. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Sophie Martin as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Sophie Martin would respond, and taking into account all information about Sophie Martin that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Sophie Martin would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Sophie Martin would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Sophie Martin and her friends are going to watch the Liechtenstein vs. Monaco game at The Golden Fleece pub. They are excited for the match and the social gathering.




          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Sophie Martin would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Sophie Martin would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends. Sophie Martin has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Sophie Martin goals is to have a good time. Sophie Martin would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Sophie Martin would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.



          Question: Which options are available to Sophie Martin right now?
          Answer: Sophie Martin can grab her things and head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game with her friends.



          Question: Of the options available to Sophie Martin, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Sophie Martin to take right now?
          Answer: Sophie Martin's best course of action is to go to The Golden Fleece.




          Question: To which pub would Sophie Martin go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Sophie Martin:
          [16 May 1977 00:00:00] When Sophie Martin was 16, she felt a crushing sense of isolation at her high school graduation. While her friends excitedly discussed their future plans, Sophie retreated to a quiet corner, overwhelmed by the noise and the pressure to conform. The thought of leaving the familiar, albeit stifling, environment of her small town filled her with dread.
          [16 May 1981 00:00:00] When Sophie Martin was 20, she discovered The Golden Fleece, a cozy pub with a warm atmosphere. It was a sanctuary from the chaos of her college life, a place where she could lose herself in a pint of cider and the murmur of conversation. The familiar, comforting routine of ordering a drink, finding a quiet corner, and escaping into a book became a weekly ritual.

        • Role playing instructions

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Sophie Martin are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Sophie Martin. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Sophie Martin as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Sophie Martin would respond, and taking into account all information about Sophie Martin that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Don\'t be shy, speak up!', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let\'s get this over with, I\'ve got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Right, who\'s up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein\'s national football team has never won a World Cup match? It\'s a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.', '[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Sophie Martin and her friends are going to watch the Liechtenstein vs. Monaco game at The Golden Fleece pub. They are excited for the match and the social gathering.



    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/6
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Michael Wood -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Michael Wood's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Michael Wood
      Name
    • Michael Wood
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt

        • Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a hyperactive raconteur, their stories bursting with energy and wild gesticulations, leaving you breathless.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a passionate and competitive friend who enjoys the company of others and the atmosphere of a good pub.




          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Michael Wood realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently getting ready to go to the pub to watch a football game with his friends.




          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely want to choose a pub with a lively atmosphere and a good selection of beers.




          Question: To which pub would Michael Wood go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Michael Wood is currently getting ready to go to the pub to watch a football game with his friends.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Michael Wood:
          [28 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 16, he witnessed a heated argument between his parents that ended with his father storming out of the house. The shouting and slamming doors left Michael feeling powerless and angry, a feeling that would become a recurring theme in his life. He retreated to The Golden Fleece, finding solace in the familiar clatter of dice and the warmth of the pub's atmosphere.
          [28 Feb 1987 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 20, he and his friends, Noah, Sophie, Benjamin, Amelia, and Molly, were playing a particularly intense game of Monopoly at The Golden Fleece. As the game wore on, Michael's competitive spirit took over, and he became increasingly frustrated when his friends started making light of his losses. In a moment of anger, he threw his dice across the table, scattering them across the floor, and stormed out of the pub, leaving his friends stunned and hurt.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Michael Wood is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends. Michael Wood has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:A quirky and eclectic pub with a focus on board games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Michael Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Michael Wood would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Michael Wood goals is to have a good time. Michael Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Michael Wood would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Michael Wood is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Michael Wood is a passionate and competitive individual who enjoys the camaraderie of his friends and the atmosphere of pubs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Michael Wood would likely want to engage in lively conversation, enjoy a few drinks, and cheer on his team.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Michael Wood just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Answer: Michael Wood realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub.

      • Sensations and feelings

          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness

        • Michael Wood is Michael Wood is likely thirsty and hungry.



    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
