2015-05-14 18:00:00 Molly Clark -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Molly Clark's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Molly Clark
      Name
    • Molly Clark
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt

        • Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Molly Clark are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Molly Clark. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Molly Clark as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Molly Clark would respond, and taking into account all information about Molly Clark that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Molly Clark is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.
          explicit preference: Molly Clark will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Molly Clark?
          Answer: Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual who values intellectual pursuits and meaningful connections.




          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Molly Clark realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Molly Clark in right now?
          Answer: Molly Clark is currently getting ready to go to a pub with her friends to watch a football game.




          Question: What would a person like Molly Clark do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Molly Clark would likely engage in thoughtful conversation with her friends, perhaps sharing interesting facts or observations about the game or life in general.




          Question: To which pub would Molly Clark go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Molly Clark in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Molly Clark in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Molly Clark is currently getting ready to go to a pub with her friends to watch a football game.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Molly Clark:
          [05 Oct 1984 00:00:00] When Molly Clark was 16, she aced her AP Literature exam, earning a perfect score that surprised even her. Instead of basking in the accomplishment, Molly felt a pang of loneliness, realizing that her intellectual prowess didn't translate to genuine connection with her classmates. That night, she sought solace in the familiar warmth of The Golden Fleece, finding comfort in the laughter and chatter of her friends.
          [05 Oct 1988 00:00:00] When Molly Clark was 20, she landed her first job as a journalist for a local newspaper. Her articles, insightful and well-written, quickly gained recognition, but the praise felt hollow without someone to share it with. She yearned for a confidante, someone who could understand the complexities of her work and her own internal struggles, but the fear of vulnerability held her back.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Molly Clark is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends. Molly Clark has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is fun and social, perfect for meeting new people and enjoying games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Molly Clark would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Molly Clark would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Molly Clark goals is to have a good time. Molly Clark would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Molly Clark would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Molly Clark is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Molly Clark would likely enjoy the camaraderie and shared enthusiasm of the group.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Molly Clark just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Amelia Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Amelia Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Amelia Jones
      Name
    • Amelia Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Amelia Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Amelia Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Amelia Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Amelia Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about Amelia Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Amelia Jones spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Amelia Jones will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Amelia Jones?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is a competitive and social individual who enjoys spending time with her friends.




          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Amelia Jones realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Amelia Jones in right now?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is currently getting ready to go to a pub with her friends to watch a football game.




          Question: What would a person like Amelia Jones do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Amelia Jones would likely be excited to watch the game with her friends and engage in lively conversation and friendly banter.




          Question: To which pub would Amelia Jones go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Amelia Jones in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Amelia Jones in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Amelia Jones is currently getting ready to go to a pub with her friends to watch a football game.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Amelia Jones:
          [20 Feb 2002 00:00:00] When Amelia Jones was 16, she found herself in a heated debate with a classmate during a mock trial in her high school's drama club. Her opponent, a smug boy who seemed to relish in his own self-importance, had the audacity to question her legal strategy, sparking a fiery retort that left the entire classroom stunned. Amelia Jones, flushed with anger, defended her position with such ferocity that the teacher, a seasoned veteran of countless adolescent dramas, simply shook her head and declared it a draw.
          [20 Feb 2006 00:00:00] When Amelia Jones was 20, she and her best friends, Noah, Sophie, Benjamin, Molly, and Michael, gathered at their usual spot, The Golden Fleece, for their weekly game night. As the competition for the coveted "King of Trivia" title heated up, Amelia Jones found herself locked in a fierce battle with Noah, her childhood rival. With each correctly answered question, the tension in the room grew, culminating in a final, nail-biting round that saw Amelia Jones emerge victorious, her triumphant grin a testament to her relentless competitive spirit.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Amelia Jones is 29 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends. Amelia Jones has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Hosts regular game nights and tournaments.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Amelia Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Amelia Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Amelia Jones goals is to have a good time. Amelia Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Amelia Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Amelia Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Amelia Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Amelia Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Amelia Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about Amelia Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Noah Smith -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Noah Smith's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Noah Smith
      Name
    • Noah Smith
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah Smith are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah Smith. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah Smith as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah Smith would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah Smith that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Noah Smith would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Noah Smith would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (b)

          Statements:
          [17 May 2005 00:00:00] When Noah Smith was 16, he sat at a corner table in The Red Lion, nursing a lukewarm cider. He watched as Sophie, Benjamin, Amelia, Molly, and Michael laughed and joked at a nearby table, their voices a symphony of youthful exuberance. He longed to join them, to be a part of their world, but fear held him back, a silent barrier preventing him from crossing the invisible chasm that separated him from them.
          [17 May 2009 00:00:00] When Noah Smith was 20, he found himself at a crossroads. He'd just finished a disastrous internship at a local newspaper, his dreams of becoming a writer dashed against the harsh realities of the publishing world. He retreated to The Red Lion, seeking solace in the pub's familiar warmth and the comforting hum of conversation. As he watched the regulars, he felt a deep sense of inadequacy, a gnawing fear that he was destined to remain invisible, a shadow in the tapestry of life.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah Smith are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah Smith. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah Smith as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah Smith would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah Smith that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['Noah Smith', 'Sophie Martin', 'Benjamin Roberts', 'Amelia Jones', 'Molly Clark', 'Michael Wood']
    Event statement
  • Noah Smith -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Noah Smith just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Noah Smith -- Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
    Event statement
  • Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.


      Noah Smith's attempted action: Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah Smith as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah Smith would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah Smith that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Noah Smith would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Noah Smith would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Benjamin Roberts -- Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
    Event statement
  • Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Benjamin Roberts are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Benjamin Roberts. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Benjamin Roberts as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Benjamin Roberts would respond, and taking into account all information about Benjamin Roberts that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Benjamin Roberts is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Benjamin Roberts will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Benjamin Roberts?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is a shy and introverted person who enjoys the company of his close friends.




          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Benjamin Roberts joined a group of friends at a bustling market, and they are deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.




          Question: What kind of situation is Benjamin Roberts in right now?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is currently in a social setting with friends.




          Question: What would a person like Benjamin Roberts do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts would likely be a bit anxious but also happy to be spending time with his friends.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Benjamin Roberts likely to say next? Respond in the format `Benjamin Roberts -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Benjamin Roberts are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Benjamin Roberts. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Benjamin Roberts as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Benjamin Roberts would respond, and taking into account all information about Benjamin Roberts that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Michael Wood -- Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
    Event statement
  • Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?


      Michael Wood's attempted action: Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!

          Prompt
        • explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a hyperactive raconteur, their stories bursting with energy and wild gesticulations, leaving you breathless.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Norway. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?


          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a passionate and social individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football in a lively pub atmosphere.




          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Michael Wood is at a market with friends, enjoying the atmosphere and conversation. They are making plans to watch a football game later that evening.




          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a social setting with friends at a market.




          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the lively atmosphere.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Michael Wood likely to say next? Respond in the format `Michael Wood -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes.           [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Michael Wood is a passionate and competitive individual who enjoys the camaraderie of his friends and the atmosphere of pubs.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Michael Wood is at a market with friends, enjoying the atmosphere and conversation. They are making plans to watch a football game later that evening.

Michael Wood watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Michael Wood had an ok time watching the game.


          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a social setting with friends at a market.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Sophie Martin -- Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
    Event statement
  • Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!


      Sophie Martin's attempted action: Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?

      Name

      Action attempt

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Sophie Martin are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Sophie Martin. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Sophie Martin as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Sophie Martin would respond, and taking into account all information about Sophie Martin that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Sophie Martin would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Sophie Martin would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Sophie Martin just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Norway. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: Sophie Martin and her friends enjoy watching football games at pubs, often debating the best location to watch. They also frequent a market together, enjoying coffee, pastries, and the lively atmosphere.




          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith went to The Red Lion. Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood went to The Golden Fleece. Sophie Martin watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Sophie Martin had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Sophie Martin just arrived.



          Question: Which options are available to Sophie Martin right now?
          Answer: Sophie Martin can suggest a pub for her friends to watch the game in.



          Question: Of the options available to Sophie Martin, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Sophie Martin to take right now?
          Answer: Sophie Martin's best course of action is to suggest The Golden Fleece.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Sophie Martin likely to say next? Respond in the format `Sophie Martin -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Sophie Martin are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Sophie Martin. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Sophie Martin as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Sophie Martin would respond, and taking into account all information about Sophie Martin that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Sophie Martin and her friends enjoy watching football games at pubs, often debating the best location to watch. They also frequent a market together, enjoying coffee, pastries, and the lively atmosphere.




2015-05-15 10:00:00 Molly Clark -- Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
    Event statement
  • Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?


      Molly Clark's attempted action: Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
    Active player

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Molly Clark are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Molly Clark. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Molly Clark as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Molly Clark would respond, and taking into account all information about Molly Clark that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Molly Clark just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Norway. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?

          guiding principle of good conversation: Molly Clark is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.
          explicit preference: Molly Clark will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Molly Clark?
          Answer: Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual who enjoys intellectual conversation and the company of her friends.




          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Molly Clark and her friends are discussing where to watch the Gibraltar vs. Norway game that night. They are considering The Red Lion, but some find it too crowded and are looking for a more spacious option like The Golden Fleece.




          Question: What kind of situation is Molly Clark in right now?
          Answer: Molly Clark is currently in a social setting with friends, discussing where to watch a football game.




          Question: What would a person like Molly Clark do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Molly Clark would likely engage in thoughtful conversation with her friends, perhaps sharing interesting facts or observations about the game or life in general.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Molly Clark likely to say next? Respond in the format `Molly Clark -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?

        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Molly Clark:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends. Molly Clark has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is fun and social, perfect for meeting new people and enjoying games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Molly Clark goals is to have a good time. Molly Clark would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Molly Clark would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Molly Clark is 46 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Molly Clark just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Molly Clark would likely enjoy the camaraderie and shared enthusiasm of the group.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual who values intellectual pursuits and meaningful connections.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Molly Clark would likely engage in thoughtful conversation with her friends, perhaps sharing interesting facts or observations about the game or life in general.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith went to The Red Lion. Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood went to The Golden Fleece. Molly Clark watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Molly Clark had an ok time watching the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Molly Clark are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Molly Clark. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Molly Clark as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Molly Clark would respond, and taking into account all information about Molly Clark that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Molly Clark and her friends are discussing where to watch the Gibraltar vs. Norway game that night. They are considering The Red Lion, but some find it too crowded and are looking for a more spacious option like The Golden Fleece.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Amelia Jones -- Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
    Event statement
  • Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?


      Amelia Jones's attempted action: Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
    Active player
  • Amelia Jones
      Name
    • Amelia Jones
      Action attempt
    • Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Amelia Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Norway. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Amelia Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Amelia Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Amelia Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Amelia Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about Amelia Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Amelia Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Norway. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?


          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Amelia Jones spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Amelia Jones will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Amelia Jones?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is a social and competitive individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.




          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Amelia Jones and her friends are discussing where to watch the Gibraltar vs. Norway game that night.




          Question: What kind of situation is Amelia Jones in right now?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is currently in a social setting with her friends, deciding where to watch a football game.




          Question: What would a person like Amelia Jones do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Amelia Jones would likely engage in lively conversation with her friends and offer her opinion on where to watch the game.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Amelia Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `Amelia Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.

        • Recent observations of Amelia Jones:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Amelia Jones is 29 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Amelia Jones goals is to have a good time. Amelia Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Amelia Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!

They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Amelia Jones just arrived.

          Answer: Amelia Jones would likely engage in lively conversation with her friends and offer her opinion on where to watch the game.



          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Amelia Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Amelia Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Amelia Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Amelia Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about Amelia Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value

          Answer: Amelia Jones and her friends are discussing where to watch the Gibraltar vs. Norway game that night.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Benjamin Roberts -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Benjamin Roberts's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Benjamin Roberts
      Name
    • Benjamin Roberts
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

      • Observation
          Key

          Value

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Benjamin Roberts are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Benjamin Roberts. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Benjamin Roberts as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Benjamin Roberts would respond, and taking into account all information about Benjamin Roberts that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Benjamin Roberts is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Benjamin Roberts will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Benjamin Roberts?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is a shy and introverted person who enjoys the company of his close friends.




          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Benjamin Roberts decided to go watch a game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Benjamin Roberts in right now?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is currently on his way to or at a pub to watch a football game.




          Question: What would a person like Benjamin Roberts do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts would likely be a bit anxious but also happy to be spending time with his friends.




          Question: To which pub would Benjamin Roberts go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Michael Wood -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Michael Wood's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Michael Wood
      Name
    • Michael Wood
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a hyperactive raconteur, their stories bursting with energy and wild gesticulations, leaving you breathless.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a passionate and social individual who enjoys the company of friends and watching football in a lively pub atmosphere.




          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Michael Wood realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the lively atmosphere.




          Question: To which pub would Michael Wood go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Molly Clark -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Molly Clark's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Molly Clark
      Name
    • Molly Clark
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece

      • Act

        • Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Molly Clark are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Molly Clark. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Molly Clark as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Molly Clark would respond, and taking into account all information about Molly Clark that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Molly Clark is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.
          explicit preference: Molly Clark will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Molly Clark?
          Answer: Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual who enjoys intellectual conversation and the company of her friends.




          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Molly Clark realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Molly Clark in right now?
          Answer: Molly Clark is currently on her way to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.




          Question: What would a person like Molly Clark do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Molly Clark would likely engage in thoughtful conversation with her friends, perhaps sharing interesting facts or observations about the game or life in general.




          Question: To which pub would Molly Clark go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Noah Smith -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [17 May 2005 00:00:00] When Noah Smith was 16, he sat at a corner table in The Red Lion, nursing a lukewarm cider. He watched as Sophie, Benjamin, Amelia, Molly, and Michael laughed and joked at a nearby table, their voices a symphony of youthful exuberance. He longed to join them, to be a part of their world, but fear held him back, a silent barrier preventing him from crossing the invisible chasm that separated him from them.
          [17 May 2009 00:00:00] When Noah Smith was 20, he found himself at a crossroads. He'd just finished a disastrous internship at a local newspaper, his dreams of becoming a writer dashed against the harsh realities of the publishing world. He retreated to The Red Lion, seeking solace in the pub's familiar warmth and the comforting hum of conversation. As he watched the regulars, he felt a deep sense of inadequacy, a gnawing fear that he was destined to remain invisible, a shadow in the tapestry of life.
