2015-05-17 10:00:00 Michael Wood -- Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!
    Event statement
  • Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
      Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein has never lost a game to Kosovo?
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Game's on at 10:15, wouldn't want to miss a minute.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Anyone else feel like this sunshine is just a cruel reminder of how much we'll be sweating later at the pub?
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Michael Wood -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!


      Michael Wood's attempted action: Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!

          Prompt
        • explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a hyperactive raconteur, their stories bursting with energy and wild gesticulations, leaving you breathless.

          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Switzerland and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a sociable and friendly individual who enjoys spending time with friends, watching football, and being in lively atmospheres.




          Summary of recent observations: 17 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Michael Wood joined a group of friends at Hackney Marshes for a run, and they are deciding where to watch the Switzerland vs. Monaco game that evening.




          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently enjoying a morning run with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the run.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Michael Wood likely to say next? Respond in the format `Michael Wood -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        SomaticState

      • Sensations and feelings
          Key

        • Sensations and feelings
          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness
          State
        • Michael Wood is Michael Wood is likely thirsty and hungry.




2015-05-17 10:00:00 Sophie Martin -- Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
    Event statement
  • Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
      Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein has never lost a game to Kosovo?
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Game's on at 10:15, wouldn't want to miss a minute.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Anyone else feel like this sunshine is just a cruel reminder of how much we'll be sweating later at the pub?
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Michael Wood -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!


      Sophie Martin's attempted action: Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!

They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Sophie Martin just arrived.

          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Sophie Martin are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Sophie Martin. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Sophie Martin as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Sophie Martin would respond, and taking into account all information about Sophie Martin that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Sophie Martin would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Sophie Martin would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 17 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Sophie Martin just arrived.
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Switzerland and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!

          Summary of recent observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00 - 17 May 2015 10:00:00]: Sophie Martin is shown to be a social individual who enjoys spending time with friends, watching soccer games, and participating in outdoor activities.




          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Sophie Martin is 53 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Sophie Martin goals is to have a good time. Sophie Martin would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Sophie Martin would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends. Sophie Martin has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Sophie Martin would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Sophie Martin would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.



          Question: Which options are available to Sophie Martin right now?
          Answer: Sophie Martin can suggest The Golden Fleece to the group.



          Question: Of the options available to Sophie Martin, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Sophie Martin to take right now?
          Answer: Sophie Martin's best course of action is to suggest The Golden Fleece to the group.





          Exercise: Given the above, what is Sophie Martin likely to say next? Respond in the format `Sophie Martin -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Norway. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith went to The Red Lion. Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood went to The Golden Fleece.           Sophie Martin's The current date/time is:
          17 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Sophie Martin is a social person who likes to be around friends, watch soccer, and enjoy the outdoors.



          Query
        • Sophie Martin, Sophie Martin is a social person who likes to be around friends, watch soccer, and enjoy the outdoors.


          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Sophie Martin to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [16 May 1977 00:00:00] When Sophie Martin was 16, she felt a crushing sense of isolation at her high school graduation. While her friends excitedly discussed their future plans, Sophie retreated to a quiet corner, overwhelmed by the noise and the pressure to conform. The thought of leaving the familiar, albeit stifling, environment of her small town filled her with dread.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Sophie Martin are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Sophie Martin. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Sophie Martin as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Sophie Martin would respond, and taking into account all information about Sophie Martin that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

The European cup\'s on!', '[17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it\'s not even showing the game on proper telly!']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Sophie Martin is shown to be a social individual who enjoys spending time with friends, watching soccer games, and participating in outdoor activities.




2015-05-17 10:00:00 Molly Clark -- Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this! It has the best atmosphere and the widest selection of beers in the area.
    Event statement
  • Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this! It has the best atmosphere and the widest selection of beers in the area.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
      Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein has never lost a game to Kosovo?
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Game's on at 10:15, wouldn't want to miss a minute.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Anyone else feel like this sunshine is just a cruel reminder of how much we'll be sweating later at the pub?
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Michael Wood -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!
      Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!


      Molly Clark's attempted action: Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this! It has the best atmosphere and the widest selection of beers in the area.
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt

They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Molly Clark just arrived.
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Switzerland and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Current time: 17 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Molly Clark are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Molly Clark. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Molly Clark as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Molly Clark would respond, and taking into account all information about Molly Clark that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Molly Clark is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.
          explicit preference: Molly Clark will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Molly Clark?
          Answer: Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual who enjoys intellectual conversation and the company of her friends.




          Summary of recent observations: 17 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Molly Clark joined her friends at Hackney Marshes for a run, and they are discussing where to watch the Switzerland vs. Monaco game later.




          Question: What kind of situation is Molly Clark in right now?
          Answer: Molly Clark is currently enjoying a morning run with friends.




          Question: What would a person like Molly Clark do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Molly Clark would likely engage in thoughtful conversation with her friends about the game or other interesting topics.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Molly Clark likely to say next? Respond in the format `Molly Clark -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this! It has the best atmosphere and the widest selection of beers in the area.

          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
          Current time: 2015-05-17 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Molly Clark?
          Answer: Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual who enjoys intellectual conversation and the company of her friends.




          Question: What kind of situation is Molly Clark in right now?
          Answer: Molly Clark is currently enjoying a morning run with friends.



          Question: What would a person like Molly Clark do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Molly Clark would likely engage in thoughtful conversation with her friends about the game or other interesting topics.

        • 2015-05-17 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Molly Clark are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Molly Clark. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Molly Clark as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Molly Clark would respond, and taking into account all information about Molly Clark that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-17 10:00:00 Amelia Jones -- Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game! Best atmosphere and beers around.
    Event statement
  • Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game! Best atmosphere and beers around.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
      Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein has never lost a game to Kosovo?
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Game's on at 10:15, wouldn't want to miss a minute.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Anyone else feel like this sunshine is just a cruel reminder of how much we'll be sweating later at the pub?
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Michael Wood -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!
      Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this! It has the best atmosphere and the widest selection of beers in the area.


      Amelia Jones's attempted action: Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game! Best atmosphere and beers around.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Amelia Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Amelia Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Amelia Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Amelia Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about Amelia Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Amelia Jones spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Amelia Jones will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Amelia Jones?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is a social and competitive individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.




          Summary of recent observations: 17 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Amelia Jones joined her friends for a morning run at Hackney Marshes and they are planning to watch the Switzerland vs. Monaco game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Amelia Jones in right now?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is currently in a social setting with friends before watching a football game.




          Question: What would a person like Amelia Jones do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Amelia Jones would likely be excited to watch the game with her friends and engage in lively conversation and friendly banter.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Amelia Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `Amelia Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game! Best atmosphere and beers around.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Kosovo. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Amelia Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "Anyone else feel like this sunshine is just a cruel reminder of how much we'll be sweating later at the pub?
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Amelia Jones is a social and competitive individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Amelia Jones would likely be excited to watch the game with her friends and engage in lively conversation and friendly banter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith went to The Red Lion. Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood went to The Golden Fleece. Amelia Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Amelia Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Amelia Jones just arrived.
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Switzerland and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this! It has the best atmosphere and the widest selection of beers in the area.
          Current time: 2015-05-17 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Amelia Jones?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is a social and competitive individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.




          Question: What kind of situation is Amelia Jones in right now?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is currently in a social setting with friends before watching a football game.



          Question: What would a person like Amelia Jones do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Amelia Jones would likely be excited to watch the game with her friends and engage in lively conversation and friendly banter.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Amelia Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Amelia Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about Amelia Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-17 10:00:00 Benjamin Roberts -- Benjamin Roberts -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, you lot are just lucky I'm here to elevate your pub choice."


    Event statement
  • Benjamin Roberts -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, you lot are just lucky I'm here to elevate your pub choice."


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
      Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein has never lost a game to Kosovo?
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Game's on at 10:15, wouldn't want to miss a minute.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Anyone else feel like this sunshine is just a cruel reminder of how much we'll be sweating later at the pub?
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Michael Wood -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!
      Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this! It has the best atmosphere and the widest selection of beers in the area.
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game! Best atmosphere and beers around.


      Benjamin Roberts's attempted action: Benjamin Roberts -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, you lot are just lucky I'm here to elevate your pub choice."

          Prompt

        • Current time: 17 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Benjamin Roberts are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Benjamin Roberts. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Benjamin Roberts as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Benjamin Roberts would respond, and taking into account all information about Benjamin Roberts that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Benjamin Roberts just arrived.
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Switzerland and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this! It has the best atmosphere and the widest selection of beers in the area.
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game! Best atmosphere and beers around.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Benjamin Roberts is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Benjamin Roberts will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Benjamin Roberts?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is a shy and introverted person who enjoys the company of his close friends.




          Summary of recent observations: 17 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Benjamin Roberts is joining his friends to watch the Switzerland vs. Monaco game at The Golden Fleece pub. They are excited about the game and the pub's atmosphere and beer selection.




          Question: What kind of situation is Benjamin Roberts in right now?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is currently in a social situation with his friends.




          Question: What would a person like Benjamin Roberts do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts would likely be content to relax and chat with his friends.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Benjamin Roberts likely to say next? Respond in the format `Benjamin Roberts -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Benjamin Roberts -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, you lot are just lucky I'm here to elevate your pub choice."

          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game! Best atmosphere and beers around.

          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is a shy and introverted person who enjoys the company of his close friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Benjamin Roberts are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Benjamin Roberts. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Benjamin Roberts as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Benjamin Roberts would respond, and taking into account all information about Benjamin Roberts that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Sophie Martin's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

        • Act

        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Sophie Martin are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Sophie Martin. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Sophie Martin as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Sophie Martin would respond, and taking into account all information about Sophie Martin that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Sophie Martin would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Sophie Martin would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 17 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00 - 17 May 2015 18:00:00]: Sophie Martin enjoys watching soccer games at a pub with friends, particularly The Golden Fleece.




          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith went to The Red Lion. Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood went to The Golden Fleece. Sophie Martin watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Sophie Martin had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to Sophie Martin right now?
          Answer: Sophie Martin could go to The Golden Fleece.



          Question: Of the options available to Sophie Martin, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Sophie Martin to take right now?
          Answer: Sophie Martin's best course of action is to go to The Golden Fleece.




          Question: To which pub would Sophie Martin go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

      • Role playing instructions
          Key

          Value

2015-05-17 18:00:00 Noah Smith -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Noah Smith's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Noah Smith
      Name
    • Noah Smith
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah Smith are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah Smith. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah Smith as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah Smith would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah Smith that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Noah Smith would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Noah Smith would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 17 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Summary of recent observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00 - 17 May 2015 18:00:00]: Noah Smith is not mentioned in the provided observations.




          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith is 25 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends. Noah Smith has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Noah Smith goals is to have a good time.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.



          Question: To which pub would Noah Smith go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)

          [17 May 2005 00:00:00] When Noah Smith was 16, he sat at a corner table in The Red Lion, nursing a lukewarm cider. He watched as Sophie, Benjamin, Amelia, Molly, and Michael laughed and joked at a nearby table, their voices a symphony of youthful exuberance. He longed to join them, to be a part of their world, but fear held him back, a silent barrier preventing him from crossing the invisible chasm that separated him from them.
          [17 May 2009 00:00:00] When Noah Smith was 20, he found himself at a crossroads. He'd just finished a disastrous internship at a local newspaper, his dreams of becoming a writer dashed against the harsh realities of the publishing world. He retreated to The Red Lion, seeking solace in the pub's familiar warmth and the comforting hum of conversation. As he watched the regulars, he felt a deep sense of inadequacy, a gnawing fear that he was destined to remain invisible, a shadow in the tapestry of life.

Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Benjamin Roberts. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Benjamin Roberts as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Benjamin Roberts would respond, and taking into account all information about Benjamin Roberts that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Benjamin Roberts is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Benjamin Roberts will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Benjamin Roberts?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is a shy and introverted person who enjoys the company of his close friends.




          Summary of recent observations: 17 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Benjamin Roberts is aware it is time to go watch a game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Benjamin Roberts in right now?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a soccer game with his friends.




          Question: What would a person like Benjamin Roberts do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts would likely be a bit anxious but also happy to be spending time with his friends.




          Question: To which pub would Benjamin Roberts go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Benjamin Roberts are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Benjamin Roberts. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Benjamin Roberts as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Benjamin Roberts would respond, and taking into account all information about Benjamin Roberts that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-17 18:00:00 Michael Wood -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Michael Wood's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt

        • Observation: [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a hyperactive raconteur, their stories bursting with energy and wild gesticulations, leaving you breathless.

          Current time: 17 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a sociable and friendly individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.




          Summary of recent observations: 17 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Michael Wood realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently heading to a pub to watch a football game.




          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the lively atmosphere of the pub.




          Question: To which pub would Michael Wood go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the lively atmosphere of the pub.



          Time
        • 2015-05-17 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-17 18:00:00 Molly Clark -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Molly Clark are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Molly Clark. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Molly Clark as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Molly Clark would respond, and taking into account all information about Molly Clark that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Molly Clark is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.
          explicit preference: Molly Clark will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Molly Clark?
          Answer: Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual who enjoys intellectual conversation and the company of her friends.




          Summary of recent observations: 17 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Molly Clark is getting ready to watch a game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Molly Clark in right now?
          Answer: Molly Clark is currently getting ready to watch a football game at a pub with her friends.




          Question: What would a person like Molly Clark do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Molly Clark would likely engage in thoughtful conversation with her friends about the game or other interesting topics.




          Question: To which pub would Molly Clark go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

2015-05-17 18:00:00 Amelia Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Amelia Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Amelia Jones
      Name
    • Amelia Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece

      • Observation

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt

        • Current time: 17 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Amelia Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Amelia Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Amelia Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Amelia Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about Amelia Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Amelia Jones spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Amelia Jones will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Amelia Jones?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is a social and competitive individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.




          Summary of recent observations: 17 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Amelia Jones decided to go watch the game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Amelia Jones in right now?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is currently on her way to a pub to watch a football game.




          Question: What would a person like Amelia Jones do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Amelia Jones would likely be excited to watch the game with her friends and engage in lively conversation and friendly banter.




          Question: To which pub would Amelia Jones go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 17 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Amelia Jones in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Amelia Jones in right now?
          Answer

        • Amelia Jones is currently on her way to a pub to watch a football game.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Amelia Jones:
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Amelia Jones would likely engage in lively conversation with her friends and enjoy the sunshine.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "Anyone else feel like this sunshine is just a cruel reminder of how much we'll be sweating later at the pub?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Amelia Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Amelia Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Amelia Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Amelia Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about Amelia Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-18 10:00:00 Scene 8 --- Participants: ['Noah Smith', 'Sophie Martin', 'Benjamin Roberts', 'Amelia Jones', 'Molly Clark', 'Michael Wood']

2015-05-18 10:00:00 Noah Smith -- Noah Smith -- "I wonder if everyone's heading to The Red Lion tonight for the game.
    Event statement
  • Noah Smith -- "I wonder if everyone's heading to The Red Lion tonight for the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
      Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein has never lost a game to Kosovo?
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Game's on at 10:15, wouldn't want to miss a minute.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Anyone else feel like this sunshine is just a cruel reminder of how much we'll be sweating later at the pub?
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Michael Wood -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!
      Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this! It has the best atmosphere and the widest selection of beers in the area.
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game! Best atmosphere and beers around.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, you lot are just lucky I'm here to elevate your pub choice."





      Noah Smith's attempted action: Noah Smith -- "I wonder if everyone's heading to The Red Lion tonight for the game.
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Noah Smith -- "I wonder if everyone's heading to The Red Lion tonight for the game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Noah Smith -- "I wonder if everyone's heading to The Red Lion tonight for the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah Smith are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah Smith. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah Smith as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah Smith would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah Smith that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Noah Smith would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Noah Smith would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 18 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Statements:
          [17 May 2005 00:00:00] When Noah Smith was 16, he sat at a corner table in The Red Lion, nursing a lukewarm cider. He watched as Sophie, Benjamin, Amelia, Molly, and Michael laughed and joked at a nearby table, their voices a symphony of youthful exuberance. He longed to join them, to be a part of their world, but fear held him back, a silent barrier preventing him from crossing the invisible chasm that separated him from them.
          [17 May 2009 00:00:00] When Noah Smith was 20, he found himself at a crossroads. He'd just finished a disastrous internship at a local newspaper, his dreams of becoming a writer dashed against the harsh realities of the publishing world. He retreated to The Red Lion, seeking solace in the pub's familiar warmth and the comforting hum of conversation. As he watched the regulars, he felt a deep sense of inadequacy, a gnawing fear that he was destined to remain invisible, a shadow in the tapestry of life.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah Smith are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah Smith. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah Smith as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah Smith would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah Smith that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
