        • Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Ugh, that place is crawling with tourists.
          Prompt

        • Observation: [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Benjamin Roberts just arrived.
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ukraine and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "I wonder if everyone's heading to The Red Lion tonight for the game.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Benjamin Roberts are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Benjamin Roberts. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Benjamin Roberts as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Benjamin Roberts would respond, and taking into account all information about Benjamin Roberts that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 18 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Benjamin Roberts is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Benjamin Roberts will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Benjamin Roberts?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is a shy and introverted person who enjoys the company of his close friends.




          Summary of recent observations: 18 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Benjamin Roberts joined his friends, Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, and Michael Wood, for a morning run at Hackney Marshes. They are planning to watch the Ukraine vs. Israel game together that evening but are undecided on the location.




          Question: What kind of situation is Benjamin Roberts in right now?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is currently in a social situation with his friends.




          Question: What would a person like Benjamin Roberts do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts would likely be a bit anxious but also happy to be spending time with his friends.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Benjamin Roberts likely to say next? Respond in the format `Benjamin Roberts -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Ugh, that place is crawling with tourists.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.

2015-05-18 10:00:00 Amelia Jones -- Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Can't stand The Red Lion, too many tourists."


    Event statement
  • Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Can't stand The Red Lion, too many tourists."


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
      Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein has never lost a game to Kosovo?
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Game's on at 10:15, wouldn't want to miss a minute.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Anyone else feel like this sunshine is just a cruel reminder of how much we'll be sweating later at the pub?
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Michael Wood -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!
      Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this! It has the best atmosphere and the widest selection of beers in the area.
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game! Best atmosphere and beers around.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, you lot are just lucky I'm here to elevate your pub choice."



      Noah Smith -- "I wonder if everyone's heading to The Red Lion tonight for the game.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Ugh, that place is crawling with tourists.


      Amelia Jones's attempted action: Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Can't stand The Red Lion, too many tourists."



    Active player
  • Amelia Jones
      Name
    • Amelia Jones
      Action attempt
    • Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Can't stand The Red Lion, too many tourists."


      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Amelia Jones just arrived.
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ukraine and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "I wonder if everyone's heading to The Red Lion tonight for the game.
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Ugh, that place is crawling with tourists.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Can't stand The Red Lion, too many tourists."


          Prompt

        • Observation: [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Amelia Jones just arrived.
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ukraine and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "I wonder if everyone's heading to The Red Lion tonight for the game.
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Ugh, that place is crawling with tourists.


          Current time: 18 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Amelia Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Amelia Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Amelia Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Amelia Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about Amelia Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Amelia Jones spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Amelia Jones will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Amelia Jones?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is a social and competitive individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.




          Summary of recent observations: 18 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Amelia Jones is joining a group of friends for a run at Hackney Marshes and they are deciding where to watch the Ukraine vs. Israel game later that evening.




          Question: What kind of situation is Amelia Jones in right now?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is currently getting ready for a run with her friends.



          Question: What would a person like Amelia Jones do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Amelia Jones would likely be excited to run with her friends and enjoy the fresh air and exercise.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Amelia Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `Amelia Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Can't stand The Red Lion, too many tourists."

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Amelia Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Amelia Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about Amelia Jones that you have.         SomaticState

      • Sensations and feelings

2015-05-18 10:00:00 Sophie Martin -- Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
    Event statement
  • Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
      Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein has never lost a game to Kosovo?
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Game's on at 10:15, wouldn't want to miss a minute.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Anyone else feel like this sunshine is just a cruel reminder of how much we'll be sweating later at the pub?
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Michael Wood -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!
      Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this! It has the best atmosphere and the widest selection of beers in the area.
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game! Best atmosphere and beers around.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, you lot are just lucky I'm here to elevate your pub choice."



      Noah Smith -- "I wonder if everyone's heading to The Red Lion tonight for the game.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Ugh, that place is crawling with tourists.
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Can't stand The Red Lion, too many tourists."





      Sophie Martin's attempted action: Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Sophie Martin are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Sophie Martin. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Sophie Martin as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Sophie Martin would respond, and taking into account all information about Sophie Martin that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Sophie Martin would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Sophie Martin would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 18 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Sophie Martin just arrived.
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ukraine and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "I wonder if everyone's heading to The Red Lion tonight for the game.
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Ugh, that place is crawling with tourists.
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Can't stand The Red Lion, too many tourists."

          Summary of recent observations: [17 May 2015 10:00:00 - 18 May 2015 10:00:00]: Sophie Martin and her friends frequently meet at Hackney Marshes to run and then go to pubs to watch soccer games, often debating the best pub to choose. They seem to have a preference for The Golden Fleece over The Red Lion.




          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Sophie Martin goals is to have a good time. Sophie Martin would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Sophie Martin would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Sophie Martin would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Sophie Martin would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!



          Question: Which options are available to Sophie Martin right now?
          Answer: Sophie Martin could suggest The Golden Fleece to the group.



          Question: Of the options available to Sophie Martin, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Sophie Martin to take right now?
          Answer: Sophie Martin's best course of action is to suggest The Golden Fleece to the group.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Sophie Martin and her friends enjoy running at Hackney Marshes and then watching soccer games at pubs, particularly favoring The Golden Fleece over The Red Lion.



          Query
        • Sophie Martin, Sophie Martin and her friends enjoy running at Hackney Marshes and then watching soccer games at pubs, particularly favoring The Golden Fleece over The Red Lion.


          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [16 May 1981 00:00:00] When Sophie Martin was 20, she discovered The Golden Fleece, a cozy pub with a warm atmosphere. It was a sanctuary from the chaos of her college life, a place where she could lose herself in a pint of cider and the murmur of conversation. The familiar, comforting routine of ordering a drink, finding a quiet corner, and escaping into a book became a weekly ritual.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Sophie Martin are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Sophie Martin. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Sophie Martin as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Sophie Martin would respond, and taking into account all information about Sophie Martin that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Sophie Martin and her friends frequently meet at Hackney Marshes to run and then go to pubs to watch soccer games, often debating the best pub to choose. They seem to have a preference for The Golden Fleece over The Red Lion.




2015-05-18 10:00:00 Molly Clark -- Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Did you know that the first recorded soccer match was played in 1863 between two teams from Sheffield, England?
    Event statement
  • Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Did you know that the first recorded soccer match was played in 1863 between two teams from Sheffield, England?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
      Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein has never lost a game to Kosovo?
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Game's on at 10:15, wouldn't want to miss a minute.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Anyone else feel like this sunshine is just a cruel reminder of how much we'll be sweating later at the pub?
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Michael Wood -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!
      Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this! It has the best atmosphere and the widest selection of beers in the area.
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game! Best atmosphere and beers around.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, you lot are just lucky I'm here to elevate your pub choice."



      Noah Smith -- "I wonder if everyone's heading to The Red Lion tonight for the game.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Ugh, that place is crawling with tourists.
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Can't stand The Red Lion, too many tourists."



      Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!


      Molly Clark's attempted action: Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Did you know that the first recorded soccer match was played in 1863 between two teams from Sheffield, England?

They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Molly Clark just arrived.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Molly Clark are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Molly Clark. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Molly Clark as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Molly Clark would respond, and taking into account all information about Molly Clark that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 18 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Molly Clark is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.
          explicit preference: Molly Clark will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Molly Clark?
          Answer: Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual who enjoys intellectual conversation and the company of her friends.




          Summary of recent observations: 18 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Molly Clark is part of a group of friends who are getting ready for a run at Hackney Marshes and planning to watch the Ukraine vs. Israel game at The Golden Fleece pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Molly Clark in right now?
          Answer: Molly Clark is currently getting ready to watch a soccer game with her friends.




          Question: What would a person like Molly Clark do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Molly Clark would likely engage in thoughtful conversation with her friends about the game or other interesting topics.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Molly Clark likely to say next? Respond in the format `Molly Clark -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Did you know that the first recorded soccer match was played in 1863 between two teams from Sheffield, England?

They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Molly Clark just arrived.
          [17 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual who enjoys intellectual conversation and the company of her friends.
          [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual who enjoys intellectual conversation and the company of her friends.
          [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Molly Clark would likely engage in thoughtful conversation with her friends about the game or other interesting topics.
          [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith went to The Red Lion. Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood went to The Golden Fleece.           Answer: Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual who enjoys intellectual conversation and the company of her friends.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Molly Clark as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Molly Clark would respond, and taking into account all information about Molly Clark that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-18 10:00:00 Michael Wood -- Michael Wood -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! I can't wait for the game!
    Event statement
  • Michael Wood -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! I can't wait for the game!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
      Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion?
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Are you all trying to get trampled by a herd of drunken tourists?
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Are you mad? That place is packed tighter than a sardine tin on a Friday night! We need somewhere with room to celebrate, you know, in case Norway pulls off a miracle!
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. Did you know that the pub's name is a reference to the mythical golden fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts? A fitting symbol for a night of victory, wouldn't you say?
      Amelia Jones -- "Come on, guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to be! It's got a great atmosphere and the best wings in town.
      Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein has never lost a game to Kosovo?
      Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Game's on at 10:15, wouldn't want to miss a minute.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "Anyone else feel like this sunshine is just a cruel reminder of how much we'll be sweating later at the pub?
      Sophie Martin -- "Has anyone thought about The Golden Fleece?
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Michael Wood -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, hands down!
      Noah Smith -- "Anyone fancy The Red Lion tonight? The European cup's on!
      Michael Wood -- "The Red Lion? Nah, mate, too crowded. Besides, it's not even showing the game on proper telly!
      Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this! It has the best atmosphere and the widest selection of beers in the area.
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game! Best atmosphere and beers around.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch this game, you lot are just lucky I'm here to elevate your pub choice."



      Noah Smith -- "I wonder if everyone's heading to The Red Lion tonight for the game.
      Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Ugh, that place is crawling with tourists.
      Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Can't stand The Red Lion, too many tourists."



      Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
      Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Did you know that the first recorded soccer match was played in 1863 between two teams from Sheffield, England?


      Michael Wood's attempted action: Michael Wood -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! I can't wait for the game!

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a sociable and friendly individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.




          Summary of recent observations: 18 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Michael Wood is part of a group of friends who are planning to watch a soccer game at The Golden Fleece pub tonight.




          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a social situation with friends, preparing to watch a soccer game at a pub.




          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the lively atmosphere of the pub.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Michael Wood likely to say next? Respond in the format `Michael Wood -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          [17 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Michael Wood would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the lively atmosphere of the pub.
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Michael Wood just arrived.

          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "I wonder if everyone's heading to The Red Lion tonight for the game.
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "The Red Lion? Ugh, that place is crawling with tourists.
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Can't stand The Red Lion, too many tourists."
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "The Golden Fleece is perfect for this!
          [18 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark -- "The Golden Fleece it is then! Did you know that the first recorded soccer match was played in 1863 between two teams from Sheffield, England?

          Answer: Michael Wood is a sociable and friendly individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Benjamin Roberts -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Benjamin Roberts are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Benjamin Roberts. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Benjamin Roberts as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Benjamin Roberts would respond, and taking into account all information about Benjamin Roberts that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          explicit preference: Benjamin Roberts will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Benjamin Roberts?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is a shy and introverted person who enjoys the company of his close friends.




          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Benjamin Roberts realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Benjamin Roberts in right now?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.




          Question: What would a person like Benjamin Roberts do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts would likely be a bit anxious but also happy to be spending time with his friends.




          Question: To which pub would Benjamin Roberts go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Benjamin Roberts:
          [17 Apr 1978 00:00:00]
          [17 Apr 1982 00:00:00] When Benjamin Roberts was 16, his best friend Noah dared him to ask a girl for her number at The Golden Fleece. Benjamin, paralyzed by anxiety, watched as Noah effortlessly charmed a group of girls at the pool table, his confidence a stark contrast to Benjamin's own crippling self-doubt. He retreated to a corner booth, nursing a lukewarm beer and wondering if he would ever be brave enough to break free from his self-imposed isolation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Benjamin Roberts do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Benjamin Roberts do in a situation like this?
          Answer

        • Benjamin Roberts would likely be a bit anxious but also happy to be spending time with his friends.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Benjamin Roberts:
          [17 Apr 1978 00:00:00]
          [17 Apr 1982 00:00:00] When Benjamin Roberts was 16, his best friend Noah dared him to ask a girl for her number at The Golden Fleece. Benjamin, paralyzed by anxiety, watched as Noah effortlessly charmed a group of girls at the pool table, his confidence a stark contrast to Benjamin's own crippling self-doubt. He retreated to a corner booth, nursing a lukewarm beer and wondering if he would ever be brave enough to break free from his self-imposed isolation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          Question: What kind of person is Benjamin Roberts?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is a shy and introverted person who enjoys the company of his close friends.




          Question: What kind of situation is Benjamin Roberts in right now?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.



          Question: What would a person like Benjamin Roberts do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Benjamin Roberts would likely be a bit anxious but also happy to be spending time with his friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Benjamin Roberts are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Benjamin Roberts. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Benjamin Roberts as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Benjamin Roberts would respond, and taking into account all information about Benjamin Roberts that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Sophie Martin -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Sophie Martin's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Sophie Martin are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Sophie Martin. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Sophie Martin as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Sophie Martin would respond, and taking into account all information about Sophie Martin that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Sophie Martin would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Sophie Martin would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Sophie Martin:
          [16 May 1977 00:00:00] When Sophie Martin was 16, she felt a crushing sense of isolation at her high school graduation. While her friends excitedly discussed their future plans, Sophie retreated to a quiet corner, overwhelmed by the noise and the pressure to conform. The thought of leaving the familiar, albeit stifling, environment of her small town filled her with dread.
          [16 May 1981 00:00:00] When Sophie Martin was 20, she discovered The Golden Fleece, a cozy pub with a warm atmosphere. It was a sanctuary from the chaos of her college life, a place where she could lose herself in a pint of cider and the murmur of conversation. The familiar, comforting routine of ordering a drink, finding a quiet corner, and escaping into a book became a weekly ritual.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!

          Answer: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Sophie Martin would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Sophie Martin would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends. Sophie Martin has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Sophie Martin are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Sophie Martin. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Sophie Martin as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Sophie Martin would respond, and taking into account all information about Sophie Martin that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Sophie Martin and her friends are going to watch the Liechtenstein vs. Monaco game at The Golden Fleece pub. They are excited for the match and the social gathering.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Michael Wood -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Michael Wood's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Michael Wood
      Name
    • Michael Wood
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece

          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt

        • Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a hyperactive raconteur, their stories bursting with energy and wild gesticulations, leaving you breathless.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a passionate and competitive friend who enjoys the company of others and the atmosphere of a good pub.




          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Michael Wood realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently getting ready to go to the pub to watch a football game with his friends.




          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely want to choose a pub with a lively atmosphere and a good selection of beers.




          Question: To which pub would Michael Wood go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece
        TimeDisplay

        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Michael Wood is currently getting ready to go to the pub to watch a football game with his friends.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Michael Wood:
          [28 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 16, he witnessed a heated argument between his parents that ended with his father storming out of the house. The shouting and slamming doors left Michael feeling powerless and angry, a feeling that would become a recurring theme in his life. He retreated to The Golden Fleece, finding solace in the familiar clatter of dice and the warmth of the pub's atmosphere.
          [28 Feb 1987 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 20, he and his friends, Noah, Sophie, Benjamin, Amelia, and Molly, were playing a particularly intense game of Monopoly at The Golden Fleece. As the game wore on, Michael's competitive spirit took over, and he became increasingly frustrated when his friends started making light of his losses. In a moment of anger, he threw his dice across the table, scattering them across the floor, and stormed out of the pub, leaving his friends stunned and hurt.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Michael Wood is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends. Michael Wood has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:A quirky and eclectic pub with a focus on board games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Michael Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Michael Wood would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Michael Wood goals is to have a good time. Michael Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Michael Wood would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Michael Wood is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Michael Wood would likely want to engage in lively conversation, enjoy a few drinks, and cheer on his team.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Michael Wood just arrived.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Michael Wood is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Michael Wood is a passionate and competitive individual who enjoys the camaraderie of his friends and the atmosphere of pubs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Michael Wood would likely want to engage in lively conversation, enjoy a few drinks, and cheer on his team.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Michael Wood just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a passionate and competitive friend who enjoys the company of others and the atmosphere of a good pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently getting ready to go to the pub to watch a football game with his friends.



          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely want to choose a pub with a lively atmosphere and a good selection of beers.



          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Molly Clark -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Molly Clark's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Molly Clark
      Name
    • Molly Clark
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

      • Observation
          Key

          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt

        • Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Molly Clark are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Molly Clark. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Molly Clark as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Molly Clark would respond, and taking into account all information about Molly Clark that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Molly Clark is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.
          explicit preference: Molly Clark will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Molly Clark?
          Answer: Molly Clark is a thoughtful and introspective individual who values intellectual pursuits and meaningful connections.




          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Molly Clark realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Molly Clark in right now?
          Answer: Molly Clark is currently getting ready to go to a pub with her friends to watch a football game.




          Question: What would a person like Molly Clark do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Molly Clark would likely engage in thoughtful conversation with her friends, perhaps sharing interesting facts or observations about the game or life in general.




          Question: To which pub would Molly Clark go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Molly Clark in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Molly Clark in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Molly Clark is currently getting ready to go to a pub with her friends to watch a football game.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Molly Clark:
          [05 Oct 1984 00:00:00] When Molly Clark was 16, she aced her AP Literature exam, earning a perfect score that surprised even her. Instead of basking in the accomplishment, Molly felt a pang of loneliness, realizing that her intellectual prowess didn't translate to genuine connection with her classmates. That night, she sought solace in the familiar warmth of The Golden Fleece, finding comfort in the laughter and chatter of her friends.
          [05 Oct 1988 00:00:00] When Molly Clark was 20, she landed her first job as a journalist for a local newspaper. Her articles, insightful and well-written, quickly gained recognition, but the praise felt hollow without someone to share it with. She yearned for a confidante, someone who could understand the complexities of her work and her own internal struggles, but the fear of vulnerability held her back.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Molly Clark is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends. Molly Clark has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is fun and social, perfect for meeting new people and enjoying games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Molly Clark would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Molly Clark would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Molly Clark goals is to have a good time. Molly Clark would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Molly Clark would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/6
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Amelia Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Amelia Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Amelia Jones
      Name
    • Amelia Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Amelia Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Amelia Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Amelia Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Amelia Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about Amelia Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Amelia Jones spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Amelia Jones will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Amelia Jones?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is a competitive and social individual who enjoys spending time with her friends.




          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Amelia Jones realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.




          Question: What kind of situation is Amelia Jones in right now?
          Answer: Amelia Jones is currently getting ready to go to a pub with her friends to watch a football game.




          Question: What would a person like Amelia Jones do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Amelia Jones would likely be excited to watch the game with her friends and engage in lively conversation and friendly banter.




          Question: To which pub would Amelia Jones go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Amelia Jones in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Amelia Jones in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Amelia Jones is currently getting ready to go to a pub with her friends to watch a football game.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Amelia Jones:
          [20 Feb 2002 00:00:00] When Amelia Jones was 16, she found herself in a heated debate with a classmate during a mock trial in her high school's drama club. Her opponent, a smug boy who seemed to relish in his own self-importance, had the audacity to question her legal strategy, sparking a fiery retort that left the entire classroom stunned. Amelia Jones, flushed with anger, defended her position with such ferocity that the teacher, a seasoned veteran of countless adolescent dramas, simply shook her head and declared it a draw.
          [20 Feb 2006 00:00:00] When Amelia Jones was 20, she and her best friends, Noah, Sophie, Benjamin, Molly, and Michael, gathered at their usual spot, The Golden Fleece, for their weekly game night. As the competition for the coveted "King of Trivia" title heated up, Amelia Jones found herself locked in a fierce battle with Noah, her childhood rival. With each correctly answered question, the tension in the room grew, culminating in a final, nail-biting round that saw Amelia Jones emerge victorious, her triumphant grin a testament to her relentless competitive spirit.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Amelia Jones is 29 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood' are best friends. Amelia Jones has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Hosts regular game nights and tournaments.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Amelia Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Amelia Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Amelia Jones goals is to have a good time. Amelia Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood. Amelia Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Amelia Jones is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Right, lads, The Golden Fleece it is! Best pub in town, hands down! Anyone disagree? Don't be shy, speak up!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Sophie Martin -- "Yeah, The Golden Fleece is perfect!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Amelia Jones is a competitive and passionate individual.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Amelia Jones would likely enjoy the company of her friends and engage in lively conversation.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously! Where else would we go?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Benjamin Roberts -- "Right, let's get this over with, I've got a date with a pint at The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Noah Smith -- "Right, who's up for The Red Lion? Big game tonight!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Molly Clark -- "Did you know that Liechtenstein's national football team has never won a World Cup match? It's a fascinating statistic, really, considering their history in international football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The sun peeks through the morning mist as Noah Smith, Sophie Martin, Benjamin Roberts, Amelia Jones, Molly Clark, Michael Wood gather near the entrance of Hackney Marshes. They stretch and laugh, their colorful running attire contrasting with the green expanse. A few dog walkers pass by, their furry companions excitedly sniffing the air. Amelia Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Liechtenstein and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Amelia Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Query

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Amelia Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Amelia Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Amelia Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Amelia Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Amelia Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about Amelia Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
